claim: Only 1,112 men in the cohort had normal glutamic pylvic transaminase levels.
extra_info: normal glutamic pylvic transaminase level refers to GOT < 60; male refers to Sex = 'M';
reasoning: The claim states only 1,112 men had normal glutamic pyruvic transaminase levels (GOT < 60). Querying the database for male patients (SEX = 'M') with GOT < 60 yields 1,924 lab records (or 45 distinct patients). Neither count matches the claimed 1,112, so the claim is contradicted by the data.

content.text:
I'll verify this claim step by step.

**Step 1: Understand the claim.** The claim states that exactly 1,112 men had normal glutamic pyruvic transaminase levels (GOT < 60, Sex = 'M').

**Step 2: Explore the database schema.**

input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:
CREATE TABLE Examination
(
    ID                 INTEGER          null,
    `Examination Date` DATE         null,
    `aCL IgG`          REAL        null,
    `aCL IgM`          REAL        null,
    ANA                INTEGER          null,
    `ANA Pattern`      TEXT null,
    `aCL IgA`          INTEGER          null,
    Diagnosis          TEXT null,
    KCT                TEXT null,
    RVVT              TEXT null,
    LAC                TEXT null,
    Symptoms           TEXT null,
    Thrombosis         INTEGER          null,
    foreign key (ID) references Patient (ID)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);
CREATE TABLE Patient
(
    ID           INTEGER default 0 not null
        primary key,
    SEX          TEXT  null,
    Birthday     DATE          null,
    Description  DATE          null,
    `First Date` DATE          null,
    Admission    TEXT  null,
    Diagnosis    TEXT  null
);
CREATE TABLE Laboratory
(
    ID        INTEGER  default 0            not null,
    Date      DATE default '0000-00-00' not null,
    GOT       INTEGER                       null,
    GPT       INTEGER                        null,
    LDH       INTEGER                        null,
    ALP       INTEGER                        null,
    TP        REAL             null,
    ALB       REAL             null,
    UA        REAL             null,
    UN        INTEGER                       null,
    CRE       REAL             null,
    `T-BIL`   REAL             null,
    `T-CHO`   INTEGER                       null,
    TG        INTEGER                       null,
    CPK       INTEGER                       null,
    GLU       INTEGER                       null,
    WBC       REAL             null,
    RBC       REAL             null,
    HGB       REAL             null,
    HCT       REAL             null,
    PLT       INTEGER                       null,
    PT        REAL             null,
    APTT      INTEGER                       null,
    FG        REAL             null,
    PIC       INTEGER                       null,
    TAT       INTEGER                       null,
    TAT2      INTEGER                       null,
    `U-PRO`   TEXT              null,
    IGG       INTEGER                       null,
    IGA       INTEGER                       null,
    IGM       INTEGER                       null,
    CRP       TEXT              null,
    RA        TEXT              null,
    RF        TEXT              null,
    C3        INTEGER                       null,
    C4        INTEGER                       null,
    RNP       TEXT              null,
    SM        TEXT              null,
    SC170     TEXT              null,
    SSA       TEXT              null,
    SSB       TEXT              null,
    CENTROMEA TEXT              null,
    DNA       TEXT              null,
    `DNA-II`  INTEGER                       null,
    primary key (ID, Date),
        foreign key (ID) references Patient (ID)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.text:
**Step 3: Query to count men with normal GPT levels (GOT < 60).**

Note: The hint says "normal glutamic pyruvic transaminase level refers to GOT < 60" and "male refers to Sex = 'M'". Let me count distinct male patients with GOT < 60.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/thrombosis_prediction.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT P.ID) FROM Patient P JOIN Laboratory L ON P.ID = L.ID WHERE P.SEX = 'M' AND L.GOT < 60;"
input.description: Count distinct male patients with GOT < 60

content.text: That gives 45 distinct patients. But the claim says 1,112. Let me check if this is counting rows (lab records) rather than distinct patients:

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/thrombosis_prediction.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Patient P JOIN Laboratory L ON P.ID = L.ID WHERE P.SEX = 'M' AND L.GOT < 60;"
input.description: Count all lab records for male patients with GOT < 60

content.text: Not 1,112 either. Let me also check if maybe the claim refers to GPT (glutamic pyruvic transaminase) rather than GOT. The hint says GOT < 60, but "glutamic pyruvic transaminase" is actually GPT. Let me check both:

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/thrombosis_prediction.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Patient P JOIN Laboratory L ON P.ID = L.ID WHERE P.SEX = 'M' AND L.GPT < 60;"
input.description: Count lab records for male patients with GPT < 60

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/thrombosis_prediction.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT P.ID) FROM Patient P JOIN Laboratory L ON P.ID = L.ID WHERE P.SEX = 'M' AND L.GPT < 60;"
input.description: Count distinct male patients with GPT < 60

content.text: None of these match 1,112. Let me follow the hint exactly — it says GOT < 60. Let me also check if the claim is about "men" counted differently, or if there's a GOT <= 60 interpretation:

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/thrombosis_prediction.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Patient P JOIN Laboratory L ON P.ID = L.ID WHERE P.SEX = 'M' AND L.GOT IS NOT NULL AND L.GOT < 60;"
input.description: Count male lab records with non-null GOT < 60

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/thrombosis_prediction.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Patient P JOIN Laboratory L ON P.ID = L.ID WHERE P.SEX = 'M';"

content.text: The count of male lab records with GOT < 60 is 1,924, not 1,112. The claim says 1,112 which doesn't match any reasonable interpretation. Let me try one more thing — checking if maybe it's GOT <= 60 or GOT being exactly normal in some range:

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/thrombosis_prediction.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Patient P JOIN Laboratory L ON P.ID = L.ID WHERE P.SEX = 'M' AND L.GOT >= 0 AND L.GOT < 60;"
input.description: Count male records with GOT between 0 and 59

content.text:
The actual count is 1,924, not 1,112. The claim is contradicted.
